nodes.bodyText: this doesn't look right, if line 136 is right.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -96,7 +160,7 @@
 
   /**
    * The version string of the VM image as defined in [Version
-   * Attributes](https://github.com/open-telemetry/opentelemetry-specification/tree/master/specification/resource/semantic_conventions#version-attributes).
+   * Attributes](README.md#version-attributes).

nodes.bodyText: It is wrong, but that is currently a limitation of the md generator: open-telemetry/build-tools#20
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -96,7 +160,7 @@
 
   /**
    * The version string of the VM image as defined in [Version
-   * Attributes](https://github.com/open-telemetry/opentelemetry-specification/tree/master/specification/resource/semantic_conventions#version-attributes).
+   * Attributes](README.md#version-attributes).

nodes.bodyText: The links are currently relative regarding the place where the markdown tables are generated in the spec. Nothing we can do about it without fixing the tool first, then we can make the YAML right again.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -96,7 +160,7 @@
 
   /**
    * The version string of the VM image as defined in [Version
-   * Attributes](https://github.com/open-telemetry/opentelemetry-specification/tree/master/specification/resource/semantic_conventions#version-attributes).
+   * Attributes](README.md#version-attributes).

nodes.bodyText: can we also reference the version of the spec that we're referencing, so it's clear we're not pulling in arbitrary SHAs?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -1,30 +1,32 @@
 #!/bin/bash
 
-DIR="$( cd "$( dirname "${BASH_SOURCE[0]}" )" && pwd )"
+SCRIPT_DIR="$( cd "$( dirname "${BASH_SOURCE[0]}" )" && pwd )"
+ROOT_DIR="${SCRIPT_DIR}/../../"
+# freeze the spec version to make SemanticAttributes generation reproducible
+SPEC_VERSION=d328331ce9dc6dec871b647b4e37a84b5396516e

nodes.bodyText:
But we are pulling arbitrary SHAs 😅
We can use tags here instead of hashes, e.g. v0.7.0 but I'm afraid that just using tags will be very limiting. Spec v0.7.0 is pretty recent, but v0.6.0 was released 5 months ago.

nodes.bodyText:
In this case it would be v0.7.0-15-gd328331. And git seems to be able to parse this as revision:
$git log v0.7.0-15-gd328331
commit d328331ce9dc6dec871b647b4e37a84b5396516e
Author: Christian Neumüller <christian.nospameuumueller@dynatrace.com>
Date:   Thu Nov 26 13:15:29 2020 +0100

    Add .gitattributes & normalize line endings (#1230)

    Co-authored-by: Armin Ruech <arminospam.ruech@dynatrace.com>

commit 2aa62dfe1efff9d25d935c52d579c44418c925d8
Author: William Armiros <54150514+willarmiros@users.noreply.github.com>
Date:   Tue Nov 24 20:17:42 2020 -0600

    Add semantic conventions for cloud provider-specific resource attributes (#1099)
